Connors","startTime":"2016-11-12 21:00:00","eventDescription":""Greg Connors’ trademark simple guitar licks and detached alienated, lonely voice are coupled with a scary command of the English language. He is the Howard Finster of music, painting vivid abstract images with his words and guitar.” Mikel K —Southeast Performer With a deceptively simple sound of an old country or blues record, Greg weaves a fresh, modern view of emotion and experience, winding them through dense branches in and out of darkness and diffused light. His own raw and vulnerable sound journey can do any listener a great service and if you've ever felt the limb snap it may just be his dry wit. Connors has been making music in supporting slots for national as well as local acts in both Atlanta and New York City. He has awakened audiences for the likes of John Mayer, Joseph Arthur, Cat Power, Smoke, Songs; Ohia, Palace Brothers, and Vic Chesnutt. He was a regular voice on Georgia State‚ WRAS with his band Front St. (w/ Will Fratesi‚ Cat Power, Tenement Hall) and with his backing rhythm section The Curb‚ (Mark Perkins‚ Brodie Stove, Andrew Brown‚ some jazz band). They regularly performed live, both on air and in clubs to benefit the voice of Georgia State. Greg Connors has played a number of venues throughout his career. From NYU independent music festivals taking him quite early to places such as CBGB's and the other early beginnings in Georgia at such local favorites as the 40 Watt Club, in Athens, and the Variety Playhouse, in Atlanta. Fairly recent appearances include performances at the Bowery Ballroom and Tonic in New York City. Lately recording and the local coffeehouse circuit with bass player and recording engineer/producer, Scott Fragala has been keeping Connors busy.","isMobileFriendly":"true","image":{"jumbo":{"path":"http://cdn.ticketfly.com/i/00/02/36/57/06-atjmbo.jpg","width":430,"height":235},"jumbo1":{"path":"http://cdn.ticketfly.com/i/00/02/36/57/06-atjmbo1.jpg","width":430,"height":235},"large":{"path":"http://cdn.ticketfly.com/i/00/02/36/57/06-atlg.jpg","width":300,"height":164},"large1":{"path":"http://cdn.ticketfly.com/i/00/02/36/57/06-atlg1.jpg","width":300,"height":164},"medium":{"path":"http://cdn.ticketfly.com/i/00/02/36/57/06-atmd.jpg","width":200,"height":109},"medium1":{"path":"http://cdn.ticketfly.com/i/00/02/36/57/06-atmd1.jpg","width":200,"height":109},"original":{"path":"http://cdn.ticketfly.com/i/00/02/36/57/06-og.jpg","width":430,"height":235},"small":{"path":"http://cdn.ticketfly.com/i/00/02/36/57/06-atsm.jpg","width":100,"height":55},"small1":{"path":"http://cdn.ticketfly.com/i/00/02/36/57/06-atsm1.jpg","width":100,"height":55},"square":{"path":"http://cdn.ticketfly.com/i/00/02/36/57/06-sq.jpg","width":100,"height":100},"squareSmall":{"path":"http://cdn.ticketfly.com/i/00/02/36/57/06-sqsm.jpg","width":60,"height":60},"xlarge":{"path":"http://cdn.ticketfly.com/i/00/02/36/57/06-atxl.jpg","width":430,"height":235},"xlarge1":{"path":"http://cdn.ticketfly.com/i/00/02/36/57/06-atxl1.jpg","width":430,"height":235},"xxlarge":{"path":"http://cdn.ticketfly.com/i/00/02/36/57/06-atxxl.jpg","width":430,"height":235},"xxlarge1":{"path":"http://cdn.ticketfly.com/i/00/02/36/57/06-atxxl1.jpg","width":430,"height":235}},"youtubeVideos":[],"embedAudio":"","embedVideo":"","urlAudio":"","urlPurchaseMusic":"","urlOfficialWebsite":"https://www.reverbnation.com/gregconnorsmusic","urlMySpace":"http://www.myspace.com/gregconnors","urlFacebook":"https://www.facebook.com/gregconnorsnyc/","urlTwitter":"http://twitter.com/gregconnorsmusic","twitterScreenName":"gregconnorsmusic"},{"id":1765993,"name":"Steve Owsinski","startTime":"2016-11-12 20:00:00","eventDescription":"Steve Owsinski is a songwriter/producer based in central NJ/Brooklyn NY. His strong melodies and gripping lyrics have landed many opportunities for him in the past few years. In 2011, the New Jersey born artist recorded his first EP, in Nashville TN with musician/producer Dave Elkins, of the band Mae. In years since, he has filmed a state of the art music video, and studied songwriting in Memphis, TN. Steve is currently working on 2 new EPs, and interning at a Booking agency in Brooklyn.","isMobileFriendly":"false","image":{"jumbo":{"path":"http://cdn.ticketfly.com/i/00/02/36/95/29-atjmbo.jpg","width":400,"height":235},"jumbo1":{"path":"http://cdn.ticketfly.com/i/00/02/36/95/29-atjmbo1.jpg","width":400,"height":235},"large":{"path":"http://cdn.ticketfly.com/i/00/02/36/95/29-atlg.jpg","width":300,"height":176},"large1":{"path":"http://cdn.ticketfly.com/i/00/02/36/95/29-atlg1.jpg","width":300,"height":176},"medium":{"path":"http://cdn.ticketfly.com/i/00/02/36/95/29-atmd.jpg","width":200,"height":118},"medium1":{"path":"http://cdn.ticketfly.com/i/00/02/36/95/29-atmd1.jpg","width":200,"height":118},"original":{"path":"http://cdn.ticketfly.com/i/00/02/36/95/29-og.jpg","width":400,"height":235},"small":{"path":"http://cdn.ticketfly.com/i/00/02/36/95/29-atsm.jpg","width":100,"height":59},"small1":{"path":"http://cdn.ticketfly.com/i/00/02/36/95/29-atsm1.jpg","width":100,"height":59},"square":{"path":"http://cdn.ticketfly.com/i/00/02/36/95/29-sq.jpg","width":100,"height":100},"squareSmall":{"path":"http://cdn.ticketfly.com/i/00/02/36/95/29-sqsm.jpg","width":60,"height":60},"xlarge":{"path":"http://cdn.ticketfly.com/i/00/02/36/95/29-atxl.jpg","width":400,"height":235},"xlarge1":{"path":"http://cdn.ticketfly.com/i/00/02/36/95/29-atxl1.jpg","width":400,"height":235},"xxlarge":{"path":"http://cdn.ticketfly.com/i/00/02/36/95/29-atxxl.jpg","width":400,"height":235},"xxlarge1":{"path":"http://cdn.ticketfly.com/i/00/02/36/95/29-atxxl1.jpg","width":400,"height":235}},"youtubeVideos":[{"videoId":"jcCGEQuV59k","title":"Steve Owsinski - More To This (Original Music Video)","embedCodeIframe":""},{"videoId":"mgOWqOt_tB0","title":"Steve Owsinski - Latch (cover)","embedCodeIframe":""}],"embedAudio":"","embedVideo":"","urlAudio":"","urlPurchaseMusic":"","urlOfficialWebsite":"http://www.steveowsinski.com","urlMySpace":"","urlFacebook":"https://www.facebook.com/steveowsinskimusic/","urlTwitter":"","twitterScreenName":""},{"id":1764440,"name":"Jonas Martin","startTime":"2016-11-12 19:00:00","eventDescription":"Since splitting from the band Goodnight Ned, Jonas Martin has had to dig deep to take control of his own destiny. Gone was the safety net of his friends, bandmates and collaborators. He had to approach songs with a new purpose which allowed him to pursue his dreams without compromise, the great dictator of his own art. His pop-fueled sonic vibes now stand alone as his true statement of intent. Martin’s writing is his quest for answers and his opportunity to spread the message of love while encouraging everyone to live their lives to the fullest. Sitting at his mother's old piano in his home studio, Martin allows his songs to present themselves in their own time. Some are eager to jump onto the page, while others take patience and reflection. However, when they choose to arrive he is ready to welcome them. In many ways Martin is a simple man, keeping the more complex parts of his psyche for his music. He likes nothing more than shooting beer cans off a wall with his Red Ryder BB gun whenever there’s some time to kill on the road. Alternatively, he’s just as happy to play a game of dominoes or kick back with his favorite companions Hemingway and Orwell. It’s all there to be heard on his second solo album The Color Scheme. The experimental nature of “Another Rerun” and “Dream I Had Last Night” can be seen as a continuation of the school boy who loved to dabble with the xylophone. The mixtape-style of “Dumbstruck AF” reveals the influence of hip hop on Martin’s writing and the social commentary of “Let Them Drown” has echoes of his beloved Randy Newman’s own work on Good Old Boys . Most of all, the album is a tribute to his late father who passed suddenly in 2014. In Martin’s words, “he was the smartest person I ever met. He was a weirdo and proud of it.” As an encouraging parent, radio DJ, curious science-fiction nerd and raconteur, his father left an indelible mark on his son’s life and love of music. All of this and more can be heard on the album’s heart-breaking cornerstone Just Like My Dad, a raw tribute akin to Lennon’s own emotional exorcism with the Plastic Ono Band. Jonas Martin makes music that means something, put your headphones on and let it mean something to you
